properties.description: Posted by ClynchHomosassa
Posted by ClynchCrystal River
Posted by ClynchYankeetown

properties.name: mariner pointe
properties.description: Posted by Cnewell3760 sextant dr sanibel island Fl

properties.name: 7-Mile Bridge
properties.description: Posted by YellowstonerLandmark on the West Entrance Road. Many fishing locations are made in reference to this crossing. Park in the Gneiss Creak trailhead parking lot and roll cast to the bridge pilings. Fish the trail side of the river for access to less fished areas.

properties.name: 7-mile Bridge
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner

properties.name: Aberdeenshire, Scotland
properties.description: Posted by GrobinsonAberdeenshire, ScotlandFishing in the land of Norman Maclean

properties.name: Admiralty Bay
properties.description: Posted by ElgerbaygroceryGood Halibut fishing here

properties.name: Admiralty Inlet
properties.description: Posted by Elgerbaygrocery

properties.name: Alaska Rainbow Lodge
properties.description: Posted by Akeene2, King Salmon, AKLooking for an Alaska fishing lodge that offers unspoiled beauty, incredible fishing and prime lodge accommodations? Look no further than the Alaska Rainbow Lodge, the finest, most centrally located Alaska fishing lodge in the Bristol Bay, Alaska region. A short flight from Anchorage, Alaska will put you in the center of excellent fishing for Alaska rainbow trout, salmon and many other species of Alaska fish that thrive in abundance at their lodge.

properties.name: Aniak River
properties.description: Posted by CparsonsThe Aniak River is located in a town called Aniak (how original) in the middle of nowhere in Alaska. I went up there last summer on a two week fishing, camping trip. It was summer time so it was light outside 24 hours a day, and it was a beautiful place. The only thing I did not like about the place was the enormity of the mosquitoes. But then again, all of Alaska is like that.

properties.name: Arrick's
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner

properties.name: Artist Paint Pot Parking
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner.. The new road and parking lot make a safe and convenient place to turn around. The walk to the paint pots is worth it in the early spring or in a wet year. .. If you plan to fish close by pick a safe place to park. The traffic along this corridor buzzes right along

properties.name: Aruba
properties.description: Posted by CparsonsTalk about deep sea fishing. Dolphin fish are beautiful fish. Great time, managed to sneak away from our Windjammer long enough to go out for a half day fishing.

properties.name: Awkward Bend
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner

properties.name: Bacon Rind Meadow
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner

properties.name: Baker's Hole Campground
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner

properties.name: Barns #1
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner .. Most popular and most fished of the Barns Holes. Contains long deep glides and riffles. Spring fishing for holdover spawners - Fall fishing for large lake-run spawning fish.

properties.name: Beaumont St., Auckland 2008
properties.description: Posted by Studio4d1 Used 17\' poles and squid. Caught 1, many bites..but couldn\'t connect to the bigguns\' Fun action all the time.

properties.name: Beaver Creek
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner

properties.name: Beaver Creek Campground
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner When the snow clears out in the Spring it\'s possible to walk the road to the steep edge of Quake Lake. Even in the snow some intrepid fishers take this stroll because of the good fishing along the shore.

properties.name: Beaver Dam Reservoir
properties.description: Posted by Burk504I hear that this is a great place to fish. Now that we have kayaks, I expect to get to know a lot more of this place.

properties.name: Benicia Shoreline
properties.description: Posted by HikingjayBenicia ShorelineThis place gets CROWDED during the salmon run, but if you don\'t mind occasional combat fishing, this can be a good place to learn to catch King Salmon from the shore line. But be forewarned if you go. Don\'t use braid and be prepared to fish literally shoulder to shoulder. Lines often tangle here and braid is very difficult to untangle, not to mention the damage it does to your neighbor\'s mono line. But, it can be a fun place where some big fish are caught. The biggest I\'ve caught here is an 18.5 lb king salmon on a #5 inline spinner. Great fun!

properties.name: Berkeley Pier
properties.description: Posted by HikingjayI try to fish here almost every Friday from the spring until mid-summer when the salmon run starts. This pier isn\'t a fish every minute, or even every trip, but it has a nice view of San Francisco and the potential to catch halibut, striper, bat rays, perch, and even the occasional sturgeon! In fact, there are lots of different fish caught here all the time. Those I\'ve listed are just a few of the more common ones.

properties.name: Biathlon Range
properties.description: Posted by YellowstonerSummer and Winter biathlon events are held on the Rendezvous ski trails. They are also excellent for a morning or evening jog or stroll.

properties.name: Bings Landing
properties.description: Posted by SaltrunA launch location for the kayak fishing guides of the St. Augustine Florida based Salt Run Outfitters ( http://www.saltrunoutfitters.com )

properties.name: Blue Ribbon Flies
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner

properties.name: Boat Launch Ramp
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner Both up-lake and down-lake from this access provides excellent Early Spring fishing. Enter from highway 287 at Campfire Lodge Road, as soon as the snow clears. When the midges are on the windward shore cluster imitations are deadly. Caddis and a nymph dropper work in the calm areas, and don\'t forget to try Yellowstone Spruce Flies around the boulders and deeper sections.

properties.name: Boating Club Rd. Ramp
properties.description: Posted by Saltrun

properties.name: Bob Jacklin's
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner

properties.name: Bud Lily's
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner

properties.name: Buffalo Ranch / Yellowstone Association
properties.description: Posted by YellowstonerHorses, Rangers, Seminars, Information.

properties.name: Bullwinkle's Saloon & Eatery
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner http://yellowstonebullwinkles.com/Fly fishing barkeep. Local bar with a Green Bay Packer flair. Extensive menu including vegetarian selections and select wines. Lunch and dinner are always very good.

properties.name: Cabin Creek
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner

properties.name: Cabins West
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner3,000 sq. foot, 2-story cabin built in early 1900\'s with gear lockers and rod storage. This wader friendly lodge is great for groups and can sleep up to - well there are six bedrooms and a sleeping loft. There is a giant kitchen and other amenities, with a host on premises and package tours available.

properties.name: Cabo San Lucas, Mexico
properties.description: Posted by CparsonsCabo San Lucas, MexicoAnother somewhat annual vacation spot yields great marlin fishing out on the Pacific Ocean. Absolutely gorgeous area.

properties.name: Cama Beach
properties.description: Posted by Elgerbaygrocery  Great Salmon, Flounder, Bottomfish and Cutthroat fishing off the beach or in a boat off shore from this beautiful Camano Island Resort, opening on June 21st 2008.

properties.name: Camano State Park Boat Launch
properties.description: Posted by Elgerbaygrocery Camano State Park has a newly renovated boat launch complete with 2 floating docks! Don\'t forget to swing by Elger Bay Grocery on your way for all of your gas, gear and food needs!

properties.name: Campfire Lodge
properties.description: Posted by YellowstonerBest breakfast in either county. Always crowded, full of fishermen, good company and many stories. It takes about 5 minutes to make good friends and there are very few \'secrets\' about the fishing here. Camping and lodges available. Call early for a place to stay on this exceptional "Between The Lakes" fishery. The stretch of water between the lakes is open all year to fishing. The best early spring fishing starts about mid-March, although there are bugs and fish available earlier. The snow gets deep - that\'s OK. Say hello to Chuck for us - we love the sausage and the weekend specials, (biscuits & gravy - but don\'t tell!) Reviews,

properties.name: Campfire Run
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner

properties.name: Campground Pool
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner -- This often overlooked pool is surprisingly deep and holds eager Brook Trout year-round. They rise freely in the early morning and the late afternoon. Appropriate size of fly is more important than pattern. Use a caddis, PMD, or other imitations in sizes 12 - 18. -- There is always a chance for a Grayling in the early Spring after the flooding has receded and in the cool days of September and October.

properties.name: Cape Hatteras National Seashore
properties.description: Posted by CparsonsAn old family favorite vacation spot. We used to go here every other summer for its seclusion. We would rent a rather large house on the beach for a week or so and just relax. We would fish on the shore and also go out to sea upwards of 15 miles to catch anything from Amberjack to Snapper to Barracudas.

properties.name: Cape Town, South Africa
properties.description: Posted by GrobinsonCape Town, South AfricaTrout, tigerfish and yellowfish

properties.name: Carp Central Baby!!
properties.description: Posted by TroutdawgCommerce City

properties.name: Casting Pond
properties.description: Posted by YellowstonerMaintained for your edification by the guides, outfitters, and instructors in West Yellowstone. Check with any local fly shop for casting instruction and practice times. Bob Jacklin holds a free casting clinic in the evenings - usually on Sunday\'s.

properties.name: Cavalero County Boat Launch
properties.description: Posted by ElgerbaygrocerySignificantly smaller than the State Park launch, you can usually expect this launch to be less populated.

properties.name: Center Hill Lake
properties.description: Posted by Cparsons18024 Smithville Hwy, Silver Point, TNNice little weekend trip for some bass fishing. Did I mention that I enjoy to fish?

properties.name: Chicken Creek
properties.description: Posted by Studio4d1 Ice-Fishing pretty good. Bites all day long...always catch over the slot and take home some nice fish

properties.name: Choice Hole
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner

properties.name: Claremont Gardens
properties.description: Posted by CelmacFriends of Catch Nature Pond

properties.name: Coastal Outdoors Kayaks
properties.description: Posted by Saltrun

properties.name: Colorado River, near Yuma, AZ
properties.description: Posted by HikingjayI used to live in Yuma and I still visit friends there occasionally. While I\'m there I try to get out on the river for some bass fishing. The fish around here can get big, and fish over 10 lbs aren\'t unheard of. The biggest I\'ve ever pulled out of here is 4.5lbs. Fishing the river here can be hot in the summer time, but it is gorgeous in the mornings and at sunset.

properties.name: Confluence - Gallatin River & Fan Creek
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner

properties.name: Contested Legal Access
properties.description: Posted by YellowstonerIt\'s legal to fish this creek between the high water marks. Cranky land owners have threatening signs and bad attitudes. This is just one of the streams in contention before the Montana Legislature this session.

properties.name: Contested Legal Access
properties.description: Posted by YellowstonerMore nasty fences and illegal attachment to public structures.

properties.name: Cooper Creek
properties.description: Posted by Dudeinky

properties.name: Coyhaique, Chile
properties.description: Posted by GrobinsonCoihaique, ChileFishing for browns, rainbows and salmon in Chile

properties.name: Culligan Island
properties.description: Posted by YellowstonerThe main channel of Grayling Creek is currently on the N.W. of this island. The whole island is considered to be below high water but this is being contested.

properties.name: Culligan Ranch
properties.description: Posted by YellowstonerYes, that Culligan, and this property line runs down the middle of Grayling Creek. Ask nicely and they may grant easy access.

properties.name: Deckers is the place
properties.description: Posted by Troutdawgdeckers, co

properties.name: Delaney Buuuutes
properties.description: Posted by Troutdawgwalden, colorado

properties.name: Destin FL
properties.description: Posted by Cnewell3601 Mountain Dr Destin, FL

properties.name: Dipper Cliff
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner-- This \'bug rich\' set of riffles is home to a few American Dippers that can be seen at all times of the year. -- The Firehole River is constrained by the cliff on the west and the eroding road bed on the east. Occasionally there is a fly fisher seen here but it is infrequent. -- The riffles are best fished with a large nymph, or streamer. The deep pools can hold large fish, and the plunge pool at the end of the riffles is an excellent place to fish stone fly imitations in late May and through June.

properties.name: Discharge Riffles
properties.description: Posted by YellowstonerTricky wading as the Plunge Pool gets wider and more shallow, this is the place for classic streamer fishing and giant nymphs. As these deep riffles swirl and slow towards the island bend there is a good chance of taking 18" - 24" fish on any day of the year. Watch for the small glassy and slick spots behind the larger rocks and boulders. Frequently there are \'giants\' to be had in the pillow water immediately up stream from the largest boulders.

properties.name: Divide Lake
properties.description: Posted by YellowstonerThis ephemeral lake sits in a saddle basin astride the divide between Grayling Creek and the Gallatin River. In wet years it holds water until August. Most years it is dry by late June to mid July. It holds no fish. A few years ago a hatchery truck broke down and because of the circumstances dumped the load in the lake. Fish to 28" were taken by locals. If you\'re cranky and ask directions for fishing in the early summer; you\'ll be directed here with tales of giant fish.

properties.name: Divide Lake
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner.. This "Lake" sits in a saddle at the divide between the Madison River drainage and the Gallatin River drainage. In recent years this little catchment has dried up by the first of July. It wet years it looks very fishy - but it\'s not. .. Eventually the Madison River will capture the Gallatin River through the headward erosion of it\'s Grayling Creek tributary.

properties.name: Divide Meadows
properties.description: Posted by YellowstonerThis section of the Gallatin River is full of willows, braided stream channels and an occasional large fish in the deeper slow runs. Fish move from place to place in this section and the fisherman tracks don\'t always lead to fish. Stealth and short casts are the ticket here. There can be prolific hatches starting in late June.

properties.name: Doug Crane Ramp
properties.description: Posted by Saltrun

properties.name: Drowned Timber Shore
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner The whole north west shore of Quake Lake has drowned timber and boulders. The tight clusters of standing dead trees also provide cover for fish. Look for dark spots close to the timber, stick-ups, or boulders for good streamer fishing. The hatches along this shore can be excellent starting in late June. Have plenty of midges and midge clusters on hand.

properties.name: Duncans boat dock
properties.description: Posted by Cnewell32329 duncan Rd. knoxville, TN 37919

properties.name: Eagle's Store
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner

properties.name: Elger Bay
properties.description: Posted by ElgerbaygroceryElger Bay is prone to many seals that swim across the Saratoga Passage, but if you can fight them off; there\'s some great fishing to be had.

properties.name: Elger Bay Grocery
properties.description: Posted by ElgerbaygroceryOur store, complete with gas, cafe and espresso stand!

properties.name: Elk Island
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner--Elk Island divides the Firehole River just before Upper Firehole Falls. Elk Run is adjacent to the road and may hold fish in early Spring before the heavy runoff starts, and again in late June through August. -- Island pool is a deep run at the end of Elk Island Glide that tails out into swift riffles just above the falls. There are fish and danger in this portion. The head of the pool is just above the pull out, and is and excellent deep glide in the earliest spring before the heavy run off begins. Most years it is not fishable until mid June. At that time it holds some very nice and very spooky fish.

properties.name: Elk Island Glide
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner

properties.name: Elk Meadow
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner .. Occasionally there is a monster hatch of Baetis in this section of the Gibbon. Usually in mid June when the weather has been cool and overcast for 2 - 3 days. If you hit it right the large fish, (to 16",) will cooperate with the dry fly fisher.

properties.name: Esturary Glide
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner

properties.name: Faithful Street Inn
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner Spring & Fall Fly Fishing Special Rates. Outfitter/Guide owned and operated. Excellent local and regional information. Wireless internet in all rooms. Speak ichthyology with the boss and tell Glenn "Hey" for us.

properties.name: Fan Creek
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner

properties.name: Fan Creek
properties.description: Posted by YellowstonerThe confluence of Fan Creek and the Gibbon River is at the north end of divide meadows. This is primarily a nursery fishery, but it does hold fish to 12" and occasionally larger in the deeper bends and protected holes.

properties.name: Fan Creek Trailhead Parking
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner .. A busy parking lot for hikers, back packers, and fishers. The willow meadows are filled with braided stream channels and hold fish - if you can find them.

properties.name: Faver-Dykes Ramp
properties.description: Posted by Saltrun

properties.name: Firehole Grill
properties.description: Posted by YellowstonerExcellent food and good local information. Owned by fly fishing guide. The omelets are spectacular. If the B-B-Q is going try the combo platter. Dinner is steaks for us. Tell Mike "Hey" for us.

properties.name: Firehole River
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner

properties.name: Firehole River
properties.description: Posted by Dudeinky

properties.name: First Meadow, Fan Creek
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner.. The willows are a problem, the moose can be dangerous, bear spray is necessary, and the fishing can be spectacular. Mosquitoes are very hungry in wet years.

properties.name: Fish Trap Bend
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner In low water years this large cut-off meander is an excellent place to sight-fish to large fish. The holding area is apparent in the photo. Dead drift a small streamer and hit \'em in the nose.

properties.name: Fishing
properties.description: Posted by Dynamite8

properties.name: Fishing in Wildwood, NJ
properties.description: Posted by Dynamite8 Grassy Sound Channel is one of the favorite fishing spots for the locals as well as tourists. You can fish & crab from boats and the shore line.

properties.name: Flaming Gorge
properties.description: Posted by TroutdawgGreen River Utah

properties.name: Fort Yargo State Park
properties.description: Posted by Milanlaw 210 South Broad Street, Winder Georgia 30680

properties.name: Gibbon Falls
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner

properties.name: Gibbon Meadows
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner.. Spring and even summer fishing is rewarding for the technical fisherman. Watch for hatches and fish the deep bends and undercut banks. Stealth is important in this clear water and the saturated meadows transmit vibrations to the water.

properties.name: Gibbon River
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner

properties.name: Gibbon River Picnic Area
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner.. The trees here cool the water noticeably and the meanders just downstream are a congregating point for both fish and fishermen. .. Park off the pavement if possible: this is a busy place. Lock your car.

properties.name: Gneiss Creek Trail
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner

properties.name: Gneiss Creek Trailhead - Parking
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner

properties.name: Golf Course Pond
properties.description: Posted by Burk504 The golf course doesn\'t mind if you fish here just before dark.

properties.name: Grasshopper Bank
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner-- In the spring this is just a big mud hole. -- In the late Summer & Fall, the vegetation on this slope produces copious numbers of grasshoppers - \'nuff said.

properties.name: Grasshopper Bank
properties.description: Posted by YellowstonerAptly named. This is the source of many hoppers in the late summer and through mild fall weather. The bright yellow Arrow-leaf Biscuitroot flowers are another reference point for local directions.

properties.name: Gravel Road To Barns Holes
properties.description: Posted by YellowstonerBe careful of the soft wet spots in the Spring. Bears and cougars are frequently seen along this road and the meadows adjacent to the river. The Barn\'s are below the cut bank to your right just past the power line cut. These were th stables for the original town of "Riverside," an army post at the west entrance to Yellowstone. At the highest magnification the map shows the ruts of the old stage roads through this ares.

properties.name: Gray Reef
properties.description: Posted by Troutdawgcasper

properties.name: Grayling Creek
properties.description: Posted by YellowstonerLow and marshy section of the creek provides excellent Spring, Summer & Fall fishing. This section is full of cut-off channels and is primarily and estuarine nursery. A few giants in the Spring and Fall if you\'re there when they are.

properties.name: Grayling Creek Bottoms
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner

properties.name: Grebe Lake
properties.description: Posted by YellowstonerAlways eager Rainbow & Brook Trout: Grayling are here in catchable numbers, and exceptional fishing is available as soon as the snow is off the trail and the ice off of the lake.

properties.name: Green Bank
properties.description: Posted by ElgerbaygroceryGreat fishing off of Whidbey\'s eastern coast

properties.name: Green Rd Ramp
properties.description: Posted by Saltrun

properties.name: Guana River Ramp
properties.description: Posted by Saltrun

properties.name: HENDERSONVILLE
properties.description: Posted by Cparsons429 W Main St, Hendersonville, TNWell, my Granny has a 300 acre farm with multiple stocked ponds on them just 5 miles down the road from my house. Though it is not the beautiful fly-fishing scene from out west or up north, it has to be my favorite place just for all the years I have grown up fishing it.

properties.name: Halff Brothers Ranch
properties.description: Posted by Akeene2Pearsall, TxHalff Brothers Ranch is an ideal ranch for bowhunters. The Frio river bottom is lushly forested land breaking into the stark beauty of thick brush and rock hills. The ranch also encampasses range land offering lengthy vistas and gorgeous terrain. The ranch is divided up into large pastures. We try to rotate which pastures we hunt on to provide less hunting pressure on the deer and to preserve the unspoiled beauty of the land. We stalk and rattle and watch the deer to decipher deer movements and patterns and we hunt from both tree stands and portable ground blinds.

properties.name: Hard Labor Creek State Park
properties.description: Posted by Milanlaw Knox Chapel Rd, Rutledge, GA

properties.name: Hat Island
properties.description: Posted by ElgerbaygroceryI\'ve heard rumors that there are some killer reefs around this island for lingcod and rockfish...

properties.name: Hebgen Dam
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner Hebgan Lake - Current Hebgan Lake - Last 30 Days

properties.name: Henry's Fork
properties.description: Posted by DudeinkyHarriman\'s Ranch The site of my first Fork Brown Trout.

properties.name: Henry's Fork
properties.description: Posted by DudeinkyCoffeepot Rapids

properties.name: Hidden Pond
properties.description: Posted by YellowstonerIn those years with a good snow pack, late and wet spring, and slow warming -- this is full of fish that have run up the outlet from Nez Perce Creek. If the Spring is early and the snow is low and Summer comes with little rain there are fewer fish. Midges are always present; sometimes caddis. It\'s not quite a barrel but it can be easy.

properties.name: Highway 287 Bridge_GC3
properties.description: Posted by YellowstonerThere\'s only one bridge near this marker. Depending on the map you choose the marker may or may not be on the bridge. Legal access to Grayling Creek can be had at this bridge. The Dude Ranch will be cranky if you go upstream. The neighbors will ask how you are doing if you go downstream. Be sure to park well off the pavement and a safe distance from the bridge.

properties.name: HoneyMoon Island, Beach
properties.description: Posted by Joninc  Hit the beach here for Snook, Spanish Mackerel, Jack Crevalle - I\'ve even seen Tarpon here at certain times.

properties.name: Honeymoon Island, Backside
properties.description: Posted by JonincFish here for Redfish and Spotted Trout.

properties.name: Hot spot5
properties.description: Posted by TroutdawgKremmling, CO

properties.name: Hubbards Yellowstone Lodge
properties.description: Posted by Akeene2Emigrant, MtPerched on its own mountain in the heart of Paradise Valley, the massive log lodge offers the finest fly fishing, five star cuisine, and beautifully appointed guestrooms with majestic views from the decks. With Merrell Lake—an 85-acre spring fed mountain lake full of trout at the front door, the enchanting Yellowstone River at the back, Montana’s famous spring creeks and Yellowstone Park minutes away, it’s hard to decide where to fish! Horseback riding on our working cattle ranch, hiking in our mountains among pine forests, and picnics next to our secluded mountain stream await.

properties.name: Island Bend
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner Most accessable portion of the Madison River "Between The Lakes." Open to fishing all year. We give it a rest starting in April when the fish are on the Redds.

properties.name: Iverson Spit
properties.description: Posted by ElgerbaygroceryI\'ve heard there\'s some fantastic Sturgeon fishing up here at the public beach

properties.name: Jack's River
properties.description: Posted by Dudeinky

properties.name: Jackson Lake Dam
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner Surprisingly good tailwater fishery. Do it from the rip-rap. Do it when the sun is low.

properties.name: Jeffrey's First Fish on a Lure
properties.description: Posted by Burk504This is a pic of Jeffrey and his first fish ever caught on a lure (taken in 2003). Pretty nice fish for a neighborhood pond!

properties.name: Jim Shockey Hunting Adventures
properties.description: Posted by Akeene2 Victoria, BCJim Shockey has hunted the world over in search of the finest big game adventures available in the most spectacular wild lands on earth. A few of these most amazing regions have so impressed Jim that he purchased the exclusive guiding/outfitting rights and now offers these best-of-the-best hunts to the general public. Jim offers hunts in the Yukon Territories from Moose, Old Mexico for Muledeer, Vancouver Island, British Columbia, for exceptional black bear, and of course Saskatchewan for those world record whitetails.

properties.name: Just walking distance from the house.
properties.description: Posted by Burk504

properties.name: Kehoe Beach, Point Reyes National Seashore
properties.description: Posted by Hikingjay  Here at Kehoe Beach, the surf can be brutal. It can be a dangerous beach due to the surf, but it is also a fun place to catch Red Tail Surf Perch. But, the fish in the picture to the right are calico\'s. The drive is about an hour and a half from San Francisco, but it is pretty. And, once you\'re at the beach the views are stunning. There have been several times when I was at this beach when I wasn\'t catching fish so I would just sit on the beach and watch the surf roll in and enjoy my day.

properties.name: Kodiak, Alaska
properties.description: Posted by MilanlawOld Harbor

properties.name: Lac de Carces
properties.description: Posted by Thebigcarphunter Like a small Cassien. Fished for one week, 3 carp to 18kg.

properties.name: Lac de St.Cassien
properties.description: Posted by Thebigcarphunter The first place i fished back in Feb 08\' for 4 months catching 69 carp, 17 over 20kg!!

properties.name: Lake Park 大沼公園
properties.description: Posted by KclamaMy other photos at Japan.

properties.name: Lamar River
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner

properties.name: Lamar River
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner

properties.name: Lamar River
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner

properties.name: Lamar River
properties.description: Posted by DudeinkyThe site of my first Cutthroat Trout.

properties.name: Landings Charters-Skidaway
properties.description: Posted by Cnewell315 Lake St Ste 270, Savannah, GA

properties.name: Lewis Falls
properties.description: Posted by YellowstonerGood and sometimes crowded fishing at base of fall.

properties.name: Lewis Lake
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner

properties.name: Lewis River Canyon
properties.description: Posted by YellowstonerGood fishing rewards the stout of leg.

properties.name: Lighthouse Boat Ramp
properties.description: Posted by Saltrun

properties.name: Little Falls
properties.description: Posted by YellowstonerInteresting part of the trail == Brook Trout congregate below here.

properties.name: Long Key State Park, Beach
properties.description: Posted by Joninc  Hit the beach here at dawn or dusk on an incoming tide (timing is everything!) for bonefish.

properties.name: Long Key State Park, Canoe Launch
properties.description: Posted by Joninc Rent a Canoe, or bring your own kayak or canoe, and fish the backwater area for Mangrove Snapper, Baby Barracuda, Snook, and other Florida Saltwater Species.

properties.name: Long Riffle
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner

properties.name: Lower Bluff Riffles
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner

properties.name: Lower Horseshoe Run Cascade
properties.description: Posted by YellowstonerThe 100 feet or so below the little cascade is usually rich with small and eager trout. This cascade marks the lower end of \'Horseshoe Run.\' The steep cliff to the north controls Grayling Creek and the run provides ample opportunity to land some nice fish. Sun is the enemy here and this run should be fished either early or late in the day.

properties.name: Lower Virginia Cascade Meadow
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner -- Tight meanders and eager Brook Trout are available here. If you\'re lucky there is a Grayling for entertainment. -- Local anglers refer to the portion of the Gibbon River between Norris Campground and Grebe Lake as the "Hidden Gibbon." -- This littl fished segment holds some surprisingly large fish, (to 14"), but the usual catch is in the 6" - 10" range. All season there are fish to be found and when the Baetis hatch or the evening caddis hatch is on the surface of this gently stream looks like nothing so much as a popcorn popper.

properties.name: Madison Campground
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner

properties.name: Madison Overlook
properties.description: Posted by YellowstonerNice place for a picnic, or to plan your next fishing location.

properties.name: Madison River
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner

properties.name: Madison River
properties.description: Posted by DudeinkyYellowstone Barn Pools

properties.name: Madison River Bridge
properties.description: Posted by YellowstonerYou can park on both sides of the road and both sides of the river. With a good roll cast you can fish between the automobile bridge and the snowmobile bridge. Large fish are tough to contain and provide a real challenge. Walk upstream on the north side or downstream on the south side to start your exploration

properties.name: Mossy Creek Fly Fishing
properties.description: Posted by Akeene2 2035 E. Market St. Suite 71A Harrisonburg, VA Brian & Colby Trow, operate Mossy Creek Fly Fishing in Harrisonburg, Virginia. From the shop they offer a guide service on local waters. This includes wade trips for trout in the mountains, spring creeks, private water or float trips on the James River or Shenandoah River for bass. Beginner classes are available through our Orvis Endorsed Fly Fishing School there in Harrisonburg, or at Wintergreen Resort. They also host fly tying clinics throughout the winter season, but private fly tying classes are available throughout the year.

properties.name: Mukilteo Halibut Run
properties.description: Posted by ElgerbaygroceryAlmost along the ferry route; some spotty success fishing for Pacific Halibut.

properties.name: Museum Meadows
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner -- The Gibbon River is joined by Solfaterra Creek in these meadows. Below the confluence there is good water all year. Brook Trout, Rainbow Trout, and the occasional wayward Grayling are available between the roads.

properties.name: Muskrat Pool
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner.. Nice pool often occupied by large muskrats - and fish.

properties.name: NFS BRIDGE_GC1
properties.description: Posted by YellowstonerMontana water law is firm on this point, (for now,): the water belongs to the residents of the state and they are within their rights to use it and the stream bed below the high water mark.

properties.name: Napeague Harbor, Beach
properties.description: Posted by Joninc  This area is also known as "The Promised Land", and for fishermen, it is! Fish here for Striped Bass and Blues.

properties.name: National Park Meadows
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner

properties.name: New Mexico Professional Big Game Hunting, Inc.
properties.description: Posted by Akeene2 Quemado, NMNew Mexico Professional Big Game Hunting is run by Mick Chapel and offers some of the best elk hunting in the country. Trophy bulls scoring in the mid to upper 300 class are killed yearly. They also offer some superb muledeer, antelope, and mountain lion hunts also in the area. New Mexico big game hunting at its finest!!

properties.name: New Road Alignment
properties.description: Posted by YellowstonerThis road will make fishing this stretch of the Gibbon River a bit tougher than it is now. Plans have not been finalized for the disposition of the old road: reclamation, abandonment, bicycle trail?

properties.name: North Bluff
properties.description: Posted by ElgerbaygroceryGreat fishing off of Whidbey\'s eastern coast

properties.name: North Platte River, Casper Wyoming
properties.description: Posted by Cparsons7400 State Highway 220, Casper, WYI used to go to school at Colorado University (in Boulder) and on fall break my freshman year I went on a random road trip and ended up in a small town in Wyoming called Casper. My buddy and I ended up trout fishing over the break in the mountains on the North Platte River.

properties.name: Oahu
properties.description: Posted by Cparsonsoahu, hawaiiWe didn\'t really catch anything on our deep sea voyage, but who care. It\'s Hawaii!

properties.name: Old Culligan Place
properties.description: Posted by YellowstonerFormerly owned by soft water king and family. They were pleasant about access and fisher folks kept the place clean and neat. Current owners will require some conversation.

properties.name: Onamac Inlet
properties.description: Posted by ElgerbaygroceryThere\'s a man made reef in this inlet that is home to many rockfish, lingcod and salmon. Very rarely visited by seals, which is a big plus.

properties.name: Onamac to Rocky Pt.
properties.description: Posted by ElgerbaygroceryLately there\'s been good reports of guys trolling between Onamac and north to Rocky Point

properties.name: One-Cast Meanders
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner-- These little nooks and crannies are full of nursery fish. Brook Trout, Rainbow Trout and the occasional Grayling are to be found here. -- This is good water for your 3 weight rod. Short casts and precise placement are necessary for the enjoyment of this surprisingly technical section. -- There are often moose and bison in the lush green foliage so be alert.

properties.name: Otter Creek
properties.description: Posted by DudeinkyThis is the creek where I cut my teeth on fly fishing. After 3 trips, this is the spot I caught my first stocked rainbow trout. Muldraugh, KY

properties.name: Outer Mongolia
properties.description: Posted by GrobinsonmongoliaTaimen fishing in outer Mongolia for the largest salmonid in the world.

properties.description: Posted by KclamaMy other photos in New Zealand.

properties.name: Parade Rest Dude Ranch
properties.description: Posted by YellowstonerPrivate guest ranch with excellent fishing. They pretend to own the river. Legal, but contested, access is available at the NFS bridge.

properties.name: Parade Rest Guest Ranch
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner Chuck Wagon cookouts, campfire songs, tame horses, dining room, and fishing. Cranky about legal access to Grayling Creek.

properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner

properties.name: Pine Shadows
properties.description: Posted by YellowstonerEverything from rustic motel rooms to private lodges and spacious condos: this wader friendly establishment is outfitter-run and sports a tying bench too.

properties.name: Playa Fiesta Mexico
properties.description: Posted by GrobinsonCarretera a Barra de Navidad 5km, Puerto Vallarta, Jalisco, México 48390Jacksmelt in the surf

properties.name: Plunge Pool Run
properties.description: Posted by YellowstonerThe deep cavitation pool at the end of the discharge stream swirls to depths that hold large fish and a an ample supply of food. This is mostly a bait and gear fishers location. It is possible to take good fish on a fly when the discharge is down and a fast sinking line with a large streamer. Use a dark spruce fly, or a dark muddler. Occasionally traditional wet flies in red or yellow, (size 8 -14,) will produce. As this section becomes shallow it is possible to wade some places. Be careful - the currents are fierce and shifting.

properties.name: Porpoise Point
properties.description: Posted by Saltrun

properties.name: Possession Bar
properties.description: Posted by ElgerbaygroceryLingcod abound on both sides of this underwater bar. It gets lower the further out you go from the bay.

properties.name: Possession Point
properties.description: Posted by ElgerbaygroceryThis area consistantly proves itself as a reliable place to find fish. Probably due to the fact that it is a "fork in the road" to go up either side of Whidbey.

properties.name: Priesters Pond
properties.description: Posted by Burk504This is a great little pond that my son and I have caught a lot of great fish in.

properties.name: Quail Creek
properties.description: Posted by Studio4d1 Short trip while in St. George, crappy lake for trout from shore...didn\'t have much luck, although we caught 1.

properties.name: Red Lake
properties.description: Posted by CparsonsWhat a trip this was. I was a little bit younger when I went on this trip, but the beauty of the place was not wasted on me. Caught tons of Northern Pike and Walleyes. Amazing place and loved staying in the cabin.

properties.name: Reeds Lake, Grand Rapids, MI
properties.description: Posted by Anglerweb Reeds Lake, Grand Rapids, Michigan Pagelink: http://www.anglerweb.com/fishingspots/spotdetails.aspx?locationid=92524

properties.name: River Moselle
properties.description: Posted by Thebigcarphunter

properties.name: Riverside
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner .. This is the old town/camp site of "Riverside." This was the original \'port of entry\' to Yellowstone National Park. .. The army used this area for a detachment, and it was also a stage stop. The large pools adjacent to this site take their name from the horse barns on the site, The foundations of which can still be seen.

properties.name: Riverside Drive
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner .. Paved remnant of original stage road into Yellowstone.

properties.name: Road To Barns Holes
properties.description: Posted by YellowstonerThis is less than a mile inside the park. Don\'t drive past it. Signal your intention to turn early. The gravel road can be dusty and it is narrow in spots - don\'t hurry.

properties.name: Roadside Bend
properties.description: Posted by YellowstonerA surprisingly deep undercut is hard to fish from the road side of the stream. Hands and knees are the best tactic, (ignore passing traffic,) and time of day is important. The shadows don\'t help the angler or the fish until after the sun is over the tree.

properties.name: Rock Creek, Montana
properties.description: Posted by GrobinsonRock Creek, Missoula MontanaBlue-ribbon trout fishing in Montana

properties.name: Roosevelt Lodge
properties.description: Posted by YellowstonerHave some beans, sit on the porch in a rocking chair, plan tomorrow.

properties.name: Running Bear Pancake House
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner

properties.name: Samsons Ridge LLC
properties.description: Posted by Akeene2Vienna, Illinois

properties.name: San Juan River
properties.description: Posted by ApaineTexas Hole, San Juan RiverThis is the Texas Hole and the main jumping off point for my trips on the San Juan.

properties.name: San Luis, New Mexico
properties.description: Posted by Cparsons, , NMCutthroat fishing at its finest. I absolutely love to fly fish and get out in the water in my waders. Beautiful.

properties.name: Seven J Outfitters
properties.description: Posted by Akeene2121 S 4th St, Sundance, WYLocated in the Black Hills of northeastern Wyoming, Seven J offers it all!! Its private leases encompass over 375,000 acres of private land strictly managed for hunting!! September offers bow hunting for whitetails, muledeer, and antelope with success rates along with opportunity rates as high as any outfitter in the country. October brings an increasing change of season and you could find yourself hunting in deep snow anytime, along with the arrival of the muledeer rifle season. As with the bowhunts in September Seven J boasts high success rates on there muledeer as well. November offers a full month of rifle whitetail hunting right through the rut!! Awesome hunting in either of the seasons. I was fortunate enough to work for Seven J in the fall of 2005 and if your looking for an awesome experience and awesome hunting look no further than Seven J!!

properties.name: Silverthorne
properties.description: Posted by Cparsons471 Rainbow Drive, Silverthorne, ColoradoMajor trout fishing area here. It actually becomes hard to describe these places for you after awhile. They are all amazing, and this place is no exception.

properties.description: Posted by Studio4d1 Ice-fishing. pretty good, have to fish in 10\' water for Rainbows, 20\' for Cuts.

properties.name: Talus Slope Riffles
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner An excellent and gentle riffle and pool with the opportunity to take fish all season with a small stonefly nymph. Prodigious hatches of caddis flies are often seen here in the evenings of late June and early July.

properties.name: Tameside Angling Centre
properties.description: Posted by CelmacComplete Angling Shop for all your fishing needs, bait, floats, rigs, line etc.

properties.name: Taylor Fork
properties.description: Posted by YellowstonerAs long as this is clear, the fishing downstream on the Gallatin River will be good. Early Spring run off, and heavy thunderstorms can cause this fork to run muddy and affect the Gallatin for miles.

properties.name: The Saltwater Angler, Inc.
properties.description: Posted by Akeene2243 Front Street, Key West, FlDave & Ernie Maynard have created the ultimate experience for fishing in Key West. Providing one of the best Florida Keys fishing guide services specially suited for your needs and ability. Their guides are professionals and will ensure that you have a pleasant and exhilarating fishing experience, whether your chasing tarpon, bonefish, or permit on the flats your gonna have the time of your life.

properties.name: The Truckee River, Glenshire Bridge
properties.description: Posted by GrobinsonTruckee, CaliforniaThe Truckee River is the best river in the world.

properties.name: The Wicked Willows
properties.description: Posted by YellowstonerThis morass of vegetation is a typical delta formation and the main channel of Grayling Creek can be found in various places - in various years. Fall fishing is excellent with pre-spawn fish holding in any number of deep bends and pools. Legal access is from the Highway 287 bridge.

properties.name: Toccoa River
properties.description: Posted by Dudeinky

properties.name: Tulalip Bubble
properties.description: Posted by ElgerbaygroceryLocated at the mouth of the Tulalip Bay where the Tulalip Chinook Hatchery feeds into, this place is usually hot when its open, which is earlier than the rest of area 8-2

properties.name: Two Feathers Cabin
properties.description: Posted by YellowstonerThis newly updated, wader friendly cabin, has 1400 sq. ft. of living space & sleeps up to six, with 2 private bedrooms, one queen bed in each, and a queen sleeper sofa in the large living room with fireplace. We offer a fully equipped kitchen, bed & bath linens, Direct TV, VCR, DVD/CD, laundry area & 2 full bathrooms.

properties.name: Upper Bluff Riffles
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner

properties.name: Upper Chocolate Run
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner -- This 200 yard stretch of river is diverse and challenging. It has riffles, rapids, glides, pools, and slides. -- It\'s mostly nymph water, but there are rising fish in the early evening that will take a caddis imitation or a floated yellow stonefly emerger. -- Most fishers drive right by and the road noise is surprisingly muted.

properties.name: Upper Horshoe Run Cascade
properties.description: Posted by YellowstonerPools at the top and the bottom of this cascade are often populated with pods of fish in both the Spring and the Fall. Hebgen Reservoir holds some strains of fish that spawn in either the Spring or the Fall. Although the Fall run is the largest and best known there are some Spring-run Rainbows that hold in these pools.

properties.name: Upper Nick Plunge Pool
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner.. A series of brief cascades lead to a deep plunge pool. The channel against the bedrock face can hold large fish, (to 14",) and the plunge pool is deep enough to hold several fish - all are usually on the feed. .. Parking is dangerous! Park close to the bridge on the upstream side. Get out of the passenger side door.

properties.name: Upper Virginia Cascade Meadow
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner

properties.name: Vilano Boat Ramp
properties.description: Posted by Saltrun

properties.name: Virginia Cascade
properties.description: Posted by Yellowstoner.. The road along this canyon is unstable with few parking places. The new road alignment will provide better access and viewing. .. The three step cascade is very attractive waterfall, and presents a barrier to most fish migration.

properties.name: Wolf Lake
properties.description: Posted by YellowstonerLooks fishy - but isn\'t. Some Grayling and Rainbows are here but it\'s tough to catch them.

The also provide day and overnight trips on the famous South Fork of the Snake River, with awesome accomidations!!!
